page.title: 09Community Policing Problems.
page.content: Whilst vandalism is the biggest problem in the Bretch Hill area of Banbury there are other things which are common. Children steal regularly from the local shops, and adults break into gas meters. People also leave their back doors open and then pop out for a few minutes giving the opportunist thief time to get in and out again. Bicycles are also stolen and the police have introduced a marking system where the postcode of the owner is stamped on the frame. There are also about fifteen children between the ages of 14 and 17 who sniff glue. They tend to use the Folly near the Wroxton Estate and the spinney at the back of Harlech Close, Bretch Hill. There is no law to stop the children doing this and so it is difficult to deal with. There are also a small number of people taking drugs.
